content: {"dataEntryDate":"2020-03-19","yearCreated":2010,"countries":["AUS","CAN","CHL","CRI","DNK","FRA","NZL","NOR","KOR","ZAF","GBR","USA"],"setting":"international","cohortCriteria":"All cohort study health outcomes in relation to environmental and occupational exposures in agricultural settings with the exception of three general population cohorts involving a large number of agricultural populations or oversampling individuals in agricultural areas.","socioEnvContext":["air_pollution"],"nbParticipants":{"total":1300000,"harmonized":316270},"age":{"min":0,"max":150},"funding":"Financed by the US National Cancer Institute and the International Agency for Research on Cancer.","methodology":{"nbCohorts":{"total":null,"harmonized":null},"harmonizationStrategy":"ex_post","moreCohortsToBeHarmonized":true,"nbHarmonizedVariables":null,"software":"na","analyses":"meta","access":{"metadata":"under_request","individualData":"na"},"dataProcessingMethods":"na","supplementaryInformation":"Harmonization has been done for specific analyses.\nSource: El-Zaemey S, Schinasi LH, Ferro G, et al Animal farming and the risk of lymphohaematopoietic cancers: a meta-analysis of three cohort studies within the AGRICOH consortium Occupational and Environmental Medicine 2019;76:827-837."},"typesOfCohorts":["population_cohort"],"website":"https://agricoh.iarc.fr/"}

description.value: The objective of AGRICOH is to support and mantain collaboration and data sharing/pooling to research the association between agricultural exposures and different health outcomes, with emphasis on associations that involve rare exposures and/or health outcomes, and for which data pooling represents a significant gain in statistical power compared to analysis of individual cohorts.

parentName.value: A consortium of agricultural cohort studies

name.value: A consortium of agricultural cohort studies
